author: Matthew Moniz
text: If you own an iPhone 14 Pro or Pro Max hows your experience been? Also, if you missed it here's the best laptops of 2022 https://youtu.be/O1_aB6Y-dDE

author: Diego Jose
text:
Super happy with my 14 pro max. Just upgraded from a 2020 SE. so it was a huge difference for me. I feel like this phone will age well since it‚Äôs the first with a dynamic island and typical apple fashion it will become the standard over the next several years. Look at the notch and how long it stuck around.

Things that I don‚Äôt like (which are just a few).
Always on display I feel like we are going to have burn in issues. The pixels don‚Äôt even shift unlike android where the pixels shift a bit to prevent it. I have mine off as I buy iPhones every 4+ years. Just want to make sure it last me as long as possible.

I wish the Dynamic Island did more. It‚Äôs a cool touch but you can tell it‚Äôs in early stages. It may take a few years for us to see its true potential.

That‚Äôs all there is to it. I overall love the phone love the size, the heft, and it‚Äôs screen.

author: Deadpool
text: This guy knows how to properly review a phone. A proper balance between showing the phone as well as his face when talking about it. What most reviewers do is they show their face for like 10 whole mins and keep talking about the phone instead of actually showing the phone. When I click a phone review video, I want to see the phone, not the reviewer's face. Period. I want to see the UI, as well as how the phone looks while holding on hand.

author: espedale
text: Went from iPhone 11 Pro Max to iPhone 14 Pro Max and I  was not impressed. Seems very gimmicky for  the money. I took a low light photo with both and the 11 was MUCH better. In normal light they look almost identical due to the pixel binning by the 14. The battery life was not much better than the 11, presumably due to the "always ON" feature. I could care less about the automobile crash notification or the dynamic island. Returned my phone and will wait for the iPhone 15.  Maybe the 15 will FINALLY support USB-C?

author: Eric Vellekoop
text:
@2:10
Optical means lense. That 2x zoom is just digital. You don't 'lose quality', because of the megapixel increase.

There are three optical lenses: ultra wide, main lense and the 3x zoom lense. There is no 2x optical zoom.
